title: Exceptional Cereal Yield
description: In 2022, Saint Vincent and the Grenadines achieved a remarkable cereal yield of 31,620.7 kg per hectare, one of the highest globally.

title: Minimal Short-term Debt Exposure
description: As of 2023, the country's short-term debt was only 0.0001% of its total external debt, indicating a strong financial position.

title: Low Air Pollution Levels
description: In 2015, only a negligible percentage of the population was exposed to PM2.5 pollution levels exceeding WHO standards, showcasing excellent air quality.

title: Negligible Methane Emissions from Transport
description: Saint Vincent and the Grenadines reported minimal methane emissions from transport in 2023, at just 0.0001 Mt CO2e.

title: Low Suicide Mortality Rate
description: In 2021, the suicide mortality rate was only 0.41 per 100,000 population, reflecting a positive mental health environment.

title: High Net Barter Terms of Trade Index
description: The country achieved a net barter terms of trade index of 185.83 in 2021, indicating favorable trade conditions.

title: Minimal Industrial Freshwater Withdrawals
description: In 2021, industrial freshwater withdrawals accounted for only 0.0235% of total freshwater withdrawals, highlighting sustainable water use.

title: Low External Debt Stocks
description: By 2023, the external debt stocks were at a minimal level of $905, showcasing strong fiscal management.

title: Minimal Nitrous Oxide Emissions from Transport
description: The country reported only 0.0003 Mt CO2e of nitrous oxide emissions from transport in 2023, indicating low environmental impact.

title: Low Grants and Other Revenue
description: In 2017, the grants and other revenue were at a low of 68,920,000 LCU, suggesting limited external financial support.
